title: Herbert Hoover National Historic Site: Hayhurst House
body: Hayhurst House        The Hayhurst House is similar to the Staples House on Poplar Street. NPS Photo by John Tobiason       In 1870, real-estate developer J.M. Wetherell sold three lots to E.S. Hayhurst. Hayhurst built his house here in 1872. Unfortunately, Hayhurst and his family were only able to call this place home for less than a decade. When they couldn't make the payments, the mortgage was foreclosed and the family left town in 1878. Ever the businessman, Wetherell repossessed the lots and turned the house into a rental property.             Subdivisions & Mortgages     In 1870, real-estate developer J. M. Wetherell managed to sell three lots to E.S. Hayhurst for $325.  Duration:55 seconds      Credit / Author: NPS   Date created: 2010-06-22     Download Original File: heho-116-HAYHURST-HOUSE1.mp3222 KB
